com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download

Class BasisDownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions<BitmapClass extends DownloadContracts.Bitmapable,ViewClass extends DownloadContracts.Viewable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.BasisDownloadInstructions.SimpleInstructions<BitmapClass,ViewClass>
      • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.BasisDownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions<BitmapClass,ViewClass>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<BitmapClass,ViewClass>
    Enclosing class:
    BasisDownloadInstructions

    public static class BasisDownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions<BitmapClass extends DownloadContracts.Bitmapable,ViewClass extends DownloadContracts.Viewable>
extends BasisDownloadInstructions.SimpleInstructions<BitmapClass,ViewClass>
    An implementation of the BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions, which returns the bitmapUid as an URL, and which does not present any temporary nor local bitmap.

    Caution: this implementation supposes that the provided is actually an in the BasisDownloadInstructions.AbstractInstructions#onBindBitmap(boolean, View, Bitmap, String, Object) method.

    • Method Detail

      • computeUrl

        public java.lang.String computeUrl(java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                          java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Given the bitmap identifier, its extra specifications, returns its URL, which will be used for downloading it.

        This method will be invoked from the GUI thread, if and only if the CoreBitmapDownloader#get(boolean, boolean, Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) method has been invoked with a isPreBlocking argument set to true. However, it is ensured that this method will be only be invoked at most once per CoreBitmapDownloader#get(boolean, boolean, Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) method invocation (i.e. for a command).

        For performance reasons, the method does not manage RuntimeException: this is the reason why the implementation should make sure that no such error occurs ; in particular, pay attention to the NullPointerException

        Returns:
        the URL that will be used to investigate on whether the bitmap is already in cache memory, persisted, and to download it from the network. If the method returns null, it will be considered that no bitmap is available for the imageUid

      • hasTemporaryBitmap

        public BitmapClass hasTemporaryBitmap(ViewClass view,
                             java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                             java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Enables to determine whether a temporary bitmap (which will be eventually a final bound bitmap if the case the provided bitmapUid is null) should be bound to the underlying view.

        The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null, but not if the CoreBitmapDownloader#get(Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) is invoked with a first argument set to null. Note that the method is granted to be invoked from the UI thread, unless the CoreBitmapDownloader#get(boolean, boolean, Viewable, String, Object, com.smartnsoft.droid4me.download.DownloadContracts.Handlerable, Instructions) is invoked with a first argument set to true.

        Parameters:
        view - the View the command should be executed against: cannot be null
        Returns:
        a non-null bitmap if and only if a temporary bitmap should be used for the underlying view: in that case, the Instructions#onBindTemporaryBitmap(View, String, Object) will be invoked with this provided returned valued
        See Also:
        #onBindTemporaryBitmap(Viewable, Bitmapable, String, Object)

      • onBindTemporaryBitmap

        public void onBindTemporaryBitmap(ViewClass view,
                         BitmapClass bitmap,
                         java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                         java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        When a temporary bitmap usage has been specified, is responsible for binding the view with that temporary bitmap.

        The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null.

        It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        bitmap - the bitmap which has previously returned from the #hasTemporaryBitmap(String, Object) method, if not null
        See Also:
        #hasTemporaryBitmap(String, Object)

      • hasLocalBitmap

        public BitmapClass hasLocalBitmap(ViewClass view,
                         java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                         java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        The method will be invoked, so as to known whether the bitmap could not be extracted locally, i.e. from the application .apk, or a static local resource.

        Do not use that placeholder for introducing any persistent strategy, but use the BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions.getInputStream(String, Object, String, BasisDownloadInstructions.InputStreamDownloadInstructor) and BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions.onInputStreamDownloaded(String, Object, String, InputStream) methods instead, for that purpose.

        Parameters:
        view - the View the command should be executed against: cannot be null
        Returns:
        true if and only the bitmap should be taken locally, instead of running into the downloading process: in that case, the Instructions#onBindLocalBitmap(View, String, Object) will be invoked
        See Also:
        #onBindLocalBitmap(Viewable, String, Object)

      • onBindLocalBitmap

        public void onBindLocalBitmap(ViewClass view,
                     BitmapClass bitmap,
                     java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                     java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        When a local bitmap usage has been specified, is responsible for binding the view with that local bitmap.

        It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        bitmap - the bitmap which has previously returned from the #hasTemporaryBitmap(String, Object) method, if not null
        See Also:
        #hasLocalBitmap(String, Object)

      • downloadInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream downloadInputStream(java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                      java.lang.Object imageSpecs,
                                      java.lang.String url)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Should download from the network the input stream corresponding to the bitmap.

        The callback is invoked when the #getInputStream(String, Object, String, InputStreamDownloadInstructor) method could not return a valid input stream. This callback will not be invoked if the CoreBitmapDownloader.isConnected() returns false.

        Returns:
        the input stream corresponding to the bitmap ; the returned should not be null in case of failure, but the method should throw a IOException exception instead
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurred while downloading the bitmap
        See Also:
        BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions.onInputStreamDownloaded(String, Object, String, InputStream)

      • convert

        public BitmapClass convert(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                  java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                  java.lang.Object imageSpecs,
                  java.lang.String url)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Invoked when a downloaded input stream need to be converted into a bitmap.

        It is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the GUI thread.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - the input stream that should be converted. It is ensured that this method will not be invoked with a null input stream

      • onBitmapReady

        public void onBitmapReady(boolean allright,
                 ViewClass view,
                 BitmapClass bitmap,
                 java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                 java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Is invoked every time, once the underlying view bitmap is either not null ready in memory (the allright parameter is set to true), or when it occurs that the bitmap could not be downloaded or is not well formed (the allright parameter is set to false).

        It is NOT ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        allright - indicates whether the bitmap is actually available and well formed
        view - will be null if, and only if the provided View is null
        bitmap - cannot be null if and only if allright is true

      • onBindBitmap

        public boolean onBindBitmap(boolean downloaded,
                   ViewClass view,
                   BitmapClass bitmap,
                   java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                   java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        Is invoked once the bitmap is ready when the provided View is not null, whether it has been downloaded from Internet or retrieved from the cache.

        It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        downloaded - indicates whether the bitmap has actually been downloaded from the network or retrieved locally
        bitmap - will never be null
        Returns:
        false if and only if the current instance did not perform the binding

      • onBitmapBound

        public void onBitmapBound(boolean result,
                 ViewClass view,
                 java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                 java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        This is the last callback that will invoked during the binding process, provided it is still required that a binding should occur (i.e. that no new binding command has not been stacked for the same view in the meantime). It is invoked once the given the bitmap identifier, its specifications and either:
        • the underlying bitmap has actually been downloaded, and attached to its View,
        • or the underlying bitmap has actually been bound to its View from a local resource,
        • or, the underlying bitmap download was a failure (wrong or null bitmap URL, connectivity problem).

        The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null.

        It is ensured that this notification will be invoked from the GUI thread.

        Parameters:
        result - true if and only if the bitmap has actually been downloaded and attached to its view

      • onOver

        public void onOver(boolean aborted,
          ViewClass view,
          java.lang.String bitmapUid,
          java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
        Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
        This method is invoked systematically once the command is over, either when it has successfully completed, or when it has been aborted.

        Do not make any assumption regarding the thread invoking that method: it may be the GUI thread or a background taken from a worker thread!

        This callback is especially useful the unitary tests.

        Parameters:
        aborted - true when and only when the command has been aborted, because another command working on the same view has also been stacked in the meantime
